Steps to reproduce:

- create the following class

- activte change method signature the constructor
- press tab, 2 x cursor down
- press remove button
- press remove button
- press preview

you get the exception from above. The problem is that the tabel cursor is 
asking the table for an item at line 1 which doesn't exist anymore.

Shouldn't the table cursor adjust itself when items get removed from the table. 
Moving to SWT for commenting.

When we remove an item we explicitly set the visibility of the table cursor to 
false.

Dirk, did you actually mean to attach code or were you being funny?  You need 
to dispose the table cursor before disposing items.

The code was for the test case I described.

When the exception happens the table still exists and has one item in it. What 
do you mean with we have to dispose the table cursor. It is a composite with 
the table as its parent so it should behave well as long as the table exists, 
independenly how many items are in the table. Especially when we set the table 
cursor's visibility to false.

Sorry Dirk my mistake.

I have just talked to Veronika and she believes you should destroy the 
TableCursor for now.
